definitions.definition: Redundant use of words, a pleonasm , an unnecessary and tedious repetition.
examples: It is tautology to say, "Forward Planning".

definitions.definition: A statement that is true for all truth values of its propositional variables .
A statement that is true for all truth values of its Boolean atoms .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) Redundant use of words, a pleonasm , an unnecessary and tedious repetition.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) An expression that features tautology.
( countable , logic , propositional logic ) A statement that is true for all truth values of its propositional variables .
( countable , logic , first-order logic ) A statement that is true for all truth values of its Boolean atoms .
